Adventure After escaping the slums of the Lower Quarter in a flying salvage ship, Chess and his ragtag crew of outcasts Hazel, Bea, Swedish, and Loretta continue their quest to find a safe haven above the fog. Start Reading Back Details
Chapter 1 They are on the run from Lord Kodoc, a ruthless ruler who is obsessed with capturing Chess because of his unique ability: he was born with fog in his lungs and can survive in it, unlike anyone else. Kodoc wants to exploit this power for his own purposes.
As they navigate the skies, the crew is exhausted and anxious. Their mentor and caretaker, Mrs. E, is gravely ill, and time is running out to find the mythical Compass, a place rumored to be safe and possibly hold a cure for her. In the opening chapter, we get a glimpse of their strong camaraderie and resourcefulness, but also the weight of their mission. Tension rises when they spot a sky patrol ship, forcing them to hide in a dangerous stretch of sky known as the Jumble, filled with drifting junk and hazards.Kodoc wants to exploit this power for his own purposes. As they navigate the skies, the crew is exhausted and anxious. Their mentor and caretaker, Mrs. E, is gravely ill
The Lord Of the Ring In the land of Middle-earth, an ancient and powerful object known as the One Ring has been found after centuries of being lost. Forged by the Dark Lord Sauron to control all other Rings of Power and enslave the world, the Ring is inherently evil and corrupts those who possess it. Preview Purchase
"Title: The Lord of the Rings Author: J.R.R. Tolkien Genre: High Fantasy / Epic Fantasy Language: English Published: The Fellowship of the Ring ‚Äì July 29, 1954 The Two Towers ‚Äì November 11, 1954 The Return of the King ‚Äì October 20, 1955 Original Publisher: George Allen and Unwin (UK) Number of Volumes: 3 Total Pages: ~1,200 (varies by edition) üßô‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è About the Story Set in the mythical world of Middle-earth, The Lord of the Rings tells the story of the struggle to destroy the One Ring, a powerful and malevolent artifact created by the dark lord Sauron. The central quest follows Frodo Baggins, a young hobbit, and his companions as they attempt to bring the Ring to Mount Doom to destroy it and end Sauron‚Äôs reign of terror."
